meanings.definition: A piece of cloth used to cover the eyes to prevent seeing.
meanings.sent1: She tied the blindfolds tightly around her eyes before playing hide-and-seek.
meanings.sent2: The magician placed the blindfolds over the volunteer's eyes for the magic trick.
meanings.sent3: The birthday girl giggled as her friends tried to pin the tail on the donkey while wearing blindfolds.
meanings.sent4: In the darkness of the cave, the blindfolds of ignorance clouded his judgment.
meanings.sent5: The blindfolds blocked out all light, plunging her into complete darkness.

meanings.definition: To cover the eyes with a cloth to prevent seeing.
meanings.sent1: He blindfolds himself before attempting to hit the pinata at the party.
meanings.sent2: The kidnappers blindfolded the hostage to keep them disoriented during the escape.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous kids blindfolded their friend and led him to a surprise birthday party.
meanings.sent4: Her fear blindfolds her from seeing the beauty of the world around her.
meanings.sent5: The illusionist skillfully blindfolds himself before performing the daring escape act.
